1.name: The Man Who Laughs
1.description: When a proud noble refuses to kiss the hand of the despotic King James in 1690, he is cruelly executed and his son surgically disfigured.

2.name: La passion de Jeanne d'Arc
2.description: In 1431, Jeanne d'Arc is placed on trial on charges of heresy. The ecclesiastical jurists attempt to force Jeanne to recant her claims of holy visions.

3.name: The Circus
3.description: The Tramp finds work and the girl of his dreams at a circus.

4.name: Steamboat Bill, Jr.
4.description: The effete son of a cantankerous riverboat captain comes to join his father's crew.

5.name: Street Angel
5.description: A woman on the run from the law finds her past catching up to her just as she is on the verge of true happiness.

6.name: The Crowd
6.description: The life of a man and woman together in a large, impersonal metropolis through their hopes, struggles and downfalls.

7.name: The Last Command
7.description: A former Imperial Russian general and cousin of the Czar ends up in Hollywood as an extra in a movie directed by a former revolutionary.

8.name: The Docks of New York
8.description: A blue-collar worker on New York's depressed waterfront finds his life changed after he saves a woman attempting suicide.

9.name: The Racket
9.description: An honest police captain vows to bring down a powerful bootlegger who is protected by corrupt politicians and judges.

10.name: Speedy
10.description: Harold "Speedy" Swift, a fan of Babe Ruth and the New York Yankees, saves from extinction the city's last horse-drawn trolley, operated by his girlfriend's grandfather.

11.name: Laugh, Clown, Laugh
11.description: A professional clown and a self-indulgent count learn to help each other with their problems, but then become romantic rivals.

12.name: La chute de la maison Usher
12.description: Allan visits the sinister Usher family mansion, where his friend Roderick is painting a portrait of his sickly wife Madeline. The portrait seems to be draining the life out of Madeline, slowly leading to her death.

13.name: Sadie Thompson
13.description: A prostitute seeking a fresh start becomes the obsession of a religious extremist.

14.name: The Cameraman
14.description: Hopelessly in love with a woman working at MGM Studios, a clumsy man attempts to become a motion picture cameraman to be close to the object of his desire.

15.name: Spione
15.description: The mastermind behind a ubiquitous spy operation learns of a dangerous romance between a Russian lady in his employ and a dashing agent from the government's secret service.

16.name: A Woman of Affairs
16.description: When two childhood sweethearts are kept from marrying, misery ensues.

17.name: Verdun, visions d'histoire
17.description: Dramatic re-enactment of the battle of Verdun during World War I, as seen by both French and German sides.

18.name: Easy Virtue
18.description: A recently divorced woman hides her scandalous past from her new husband and his family.

19.name: Alraune
19.description: A scientist interested in the laws of heredity, impregnates a prostitute in a laboratory with the semen of a hanged murderer. The prostitute conceives a female child who has no concept of love, whom the professor adopts.

20.name: Show People
20.description: A young lady from Georgia goes to Hollywood in the hopes of becoming an actress.

21.name: Our Dancing Daughters
21.description: A flapper who's secretly a good girl and a gold digging floozy masquerading as an ingénue both vie for the hand of a millionaire.

22.name: Noah's Ark
22.description: The Biblical story of Noah and the Great Flood, with a parallel story of soldiers in the First World War.

23.name: The Farmer's Wife
23.description: After his daughter weds, a middle-aged widower with a profitable farm decides to remarry, but finds choosing a suitable mate a problematic process.

24.name: The Wind
24.description: A frail young woman from the east moves in with her cousin in the west, where she causes tension within the family and is slowly driven mad.

25.name: The Mating Call
25.description: A WWI vet takes on the KKK when he loses his wife to a womanizing Klansman.

26.name: Champagne
26.description: A spoiled heiress defies her father by running off to marry her lover. However, Daddy has a few tricks up his sleeve.

27.name: 4 Devils
27.description: Four orphans, raised by an aging clown, becomes a high wire act in a circus.

28.name: Lonesome
28.description: Two lonely people in the big city meet and enjoy the thrills of an amusement park, only to lose each other in the crowd after spending a great day together. Will they ever see each other again?

29.name: Beggars of Life
29.description: After killing her treacherous step-father, a girl tries to escape the country with a young vagabond. She dresses as a boy, they hop freight trains, quarrel with a group of hobos, and steal ...                See full summary »

30.name: The Last Warning
30.description: A producer decides to reopen a theater, that had been closed five years previously when one of the actors was murdered during a performance, by staging a production of the same play with ...                See full summary »

31.name: The Patriot
31.description: In 18th-Century Russia, the Czar, Paul, is surrounded by murderous plots and trusts only Count Pahlen. Pahlen wishes to protect his friend, the mad king, but because of the horror of the ...                See full summary »

32.name: West of Zanzibar
32.description: A magician seeks vengeance upon the man who paralyzed him and the illegitimate daughter he sired with the magician's wife.

33.name: Potomok Chingis-Khana
33.description: In 1918 a simple Mongolian herdsman escapes to the hills after brawling with a western capitalist fur trader who cheats him. In 1920 he helps the partisans fight for the Soviets against the...                See full summary »

34.name: Geschlecht in Fesseln
34.description: A young man is convicted of manslaughter and sentenced to a term in prison. There he forms a close relationship with his cellmate and upon his release his wife is concerned as to how prison has changed the man she married.

35.name: Rose-Marie
35.description: Sergeant Malone of the Mounties and effeminate Etienne Doray are both in love with Rose-Marie, but she doesn't light up until soldier of fortune Jim Kenyon drifts into the post. Soon Jim is...                See full summary »

36.name: In Old Arizona
36.description: A charming, happy-go-lucky bandit in old Arizona plays cat-and-mouse with the sheriff trying to catch him while he romances a local beauty.

37.name: L'argent
37.description: The business tycoon Nicolas Saccard is nearly ruined by his rival Gunderman, when he tries to raise capital for his company. To push up the price of his stock, Saccard plans a publicity ...                See full summary »

38.name: The Mysterious Lady
38.description: An attractive Russian spy seduces an Austrian officer in order to get some important plans, but when she actually falls in love with him, both of them are placed in a dangerous situation.

39.name: The Wedding March
39.description: A young impoverished aristocrat falls in love with an inn-keepers daughter, but has to marry money.

40.name: Moulin Rouge
40.description: Parysia is the rage of Paris. She has a daughter, secretly engaged to Andre, and the boy's aristocratic father objects to the alliance because of Margaret's mother being a revue artist. ...                See full summary »

41.name: Shooting Stars
41.description: The husband and wife acting team of Mae Feather and Julian Gordon is torn apart when he discovers she is having an affair with the screen comedian Andy Wilks. Mae hatches a plot to kill her...                See full summary »

42.name: Four Sons
42.description: A family saga in which three of a Bavarian widow's sons go to war for Germany and the fourth goes to America, Germany's eventual opponent.

43.name: Shiraz
43.description: A historical romance set in the Mughal Empire. Selima (Enakshi) is a princess-foundling raised by a potter and loved by her brother, Shiraz (Rai). She is abducted and sold as a slave to ...                See full summary »

44.name: The River
44.description: A naïve young man is working on a logging camp beside a turbulent river. When it closes for winter, he opts to stay for the experience. He meets a woman who was the girlfriend to the boss ...                See full summary »

45.name: The Divine Lady
45.description: The story of the romance between Emma, Lady Hamilton, and British war hero Admiral Horatio Nelson.

46.name: The Godless Girl
46.description: Two teenagers, one an atheist and the other a Christian, fall in love at a brutal reform school.

47.name: The Trail of '98
47.description: Fortune hunters from all over the country rush to the Klondike in 1897 to seek their fortunes in the gold are tested by hardships of the journey.

48.name: White Shadows in the South Seas
48.description: An alcoholic doctor on a Polynesian island, disgusted by white exploitation of the natives, finds himself marooned on a pristinely beautiful island.

49.name: Lights of New York
49.description: Two men are conned into bootlegging business.

50.name: The Viking
50.description: Vikings compete for power and the love of a woman.
